meta.title: From KITCHEN to SINK
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: It’s finally fall. The Raddles this week are all related to "fall". Kitchen sink cookies, so-named because they contain "everything but the kitchen sink", often contain things like potato chips, toffee and pretzels. The appliance has also lent its name to a British cultural movement — kitchen sink realism — of the late 1950s and early 1960s, which focused on the domestic lives of the working class.
